Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Three-dimensional interconnected octahedral and tetrahedral cages accessed through triangular windows

Other Information.Additional Info: Fully reversible type-I adsorption behavior observed.
Readily adsorbed, confirmed by TG-DSC and breakthrough tests.
No adsorption observed, confirmed by TG-DSC and breakthrough tests. Not retained in column.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on rigid pore apertures and size exclusion

Experimental Validation.Method: Single gas adsorption isotherms, mixed gas breakthrough tests, TG-DSC, calorimetry
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Total exclusion of branched paraffins (isobutane, isopentane) from normal paraffins (n-butane, n-pentane); infinite selectivity toward normal paraffins; n-butane adsorbed amount: 0.8 mmol/g

Other Information.Additional Info: Synthesized using isoreticular chemistry for aperture size fine-tuning. Exhibits high thermal stability and chemical stability (solvents, moisture).
